Falters at times: The claim falters at times because it suggests that the individual making the claim was not present when the red line against Syria was drawn, which contradicts the fact that they were in a position of authority at the time.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the individual making the claim, who is identified as Clinton, was actually present as secretary of state when the red line was drawn against Syria.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the assertion that the individual making the claim was not present when the red line against Syria was drawn.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that being "gone" means not being present or involved in the decision-making process, which may not necessarily be the case.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the individual making the claim may have been aware of the red line but did not have direct involvement or authority in its implementation.
